Text:
Was never a big sci-fi fan, but I always enjoyed this one.

Thanks.

Please note there are 3 Different StarGate 1994 Blu-ray releases from MGM before answering the following Question:

Is this the Stargate 15th Anniversary Edition (Released: 10/27/2009)??

http://www.amazon.com/Stargate-15th-Anniversary-Blu-ray-Russell/dp/B002KPINY8

Thanks in Advance :-)
i believe the 15th Anniversary Edition when you look at the running time of the movie,this one i don't own picked it up from net flix copied it and put in the mail that night

yea runtime seem to be closest to the 15th Anniversary Edition, only 1 min diff compared to the other two which are both 6-8mins shorter, reason i ask is cuz the picture in the torrent look like the older version...... [Just off the Phone with local Retailer] Actually funny first time a Torrent has made me purchase a Movie Legit(Bout to head to BestBuy) even though in mid-download, lol...... Rather Own this one, and help the Franchise at the same time :-) (Not as if i dont have a bootleg copy allready, haha)

sorry i couldn't help, but see your proof that downloading sells more movies!
i guess this torrent thingy isn't really killing off the movie industry.
have a great weekend

bobnjeff

Yea not only did I pickup the  Stargate (1994) 15th Anniversary Edition for $24.99 (Could have found it cheaper $15.99[Amaazon] but wanted it Today), but I also grabbed a nice family movie That I've always enjoyed the story of (The Pursuit of Happyness [$16.99]) that I found when looking...... All  which I've gotten copies of via the Release Scene or Torrent Scene in the past, Although I actually Snuck into The Theater in '94 for StarGate aswell (Huge SG/SG-1/SGA/SGU Fan here as you can see). So I guess you can say the Scene does Help sell movies (Good Movies).

p.s.- Thanks for everything, If i didnt see this on here I wouldnt have ran out to get it earlier. Haven't watched it in a while now (since DvDRiP & TV), 1080p version rocks plus all the goodies on the Disc. Bridge is VERY Happy!!

;-)
